description: Erection of single/two storey building for use as a foundation unit. Formation of vehicular access and provision of car parking area.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (5341/P101, 5341/P102,  5341/P103, 5341/P104, 5341/P105, 5341/P106, 5341/P107, 5341/P108, 5341/P109, 5341/P110, Tree survey and protection statement (received 19/08/2013)
Planting proposals and specification, PP-CC/734AR1966 Rev 0, 5341/P118 Rev A, 5341/P119 Rev A (received 10/10/2013)
Transport Assessment (received 05/12/2013)) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The measures contained in the Travel Plan shall be implemented as approved.

Condition : 4 - The electric car charging point shall be provided as specified in the application prior to the occupation of the buildings.  The electric car charging point shall then be maintained in working order for as long as the development remains in existence.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the development full details of the cycle parking shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.  The cycle parking shall be implemented as approved prior to the occupation of the building and shall be maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
Condition : 6 - The development shall be carried out and used in accordance with the Delivery and Servicing Plan and Construction Logistics Plan submitted with the application.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of works, a BREEAM Pre-Assessment, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or equivalent accredited body), must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum Very Good rating (aspiring to Excellent) will be achieved.

Condition : 8 - Within 3 months of work starting on site, a BREEAM Interim (Design Stage) Certificate, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) (or equivalent accredited body), must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum Very Good rating (aspiring to Excellent) will be achieved.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation, a BREEAM Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, issued by the BRE (or equivalent accredited body), must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that a Very Good rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.

Condition : 10 - Prior to the commencement of the development evidence shall be submitted demonstrating that a scheme for achieving a minimum of 25% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions can be achieved.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the occupation of the development evidence shall be submitted demonstrating that a scheme for achieving a minimum of 25% reduction in carbon dioxide emissions has been implemented as approved.

Condition : 12 - In this condition "retained tree" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the approved plans and particulars; and paragraphs (a) and (b) below shall have effect until the expiration of 5 years from the date of the occupation of the building for its permitted use.

(a)	No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority.  Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard[3998 (Tree Work)] or any other BS replacing.

(b)	If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority.

(c)	The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.  Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.

Condition : 13 - The landscaping scheme shall be provided as specified in the application prior to the occupation of the development.  Any planting that is damaged or dies within 5 years of occupation shall be replaced with planting that is the same size and species as approved.

Condition : 14 - Full details of all boundary treatment shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the develiopment.  The boundary treatment shall be completed in accordance with the approved details pior to the occupation of the development.
Condition : 15 - The refuse storage shall be provided as specified in the application prior to the occupation of the development.

Condition : 16 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of thebuilding and the hardstanding materials have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details
